intro: Terpsichore stella, commonly known as the starflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white, yellow, and orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and prefers well-drained, sandy soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often reddish in color. Terpsichore stella is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
